data.title: text Search isn't working at
data.body:
### Description

text Search isn't working at 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. at any normal document control+f 
2. type any text which is in the document to the search area,
3. see that there is no results,
4. close the document, re-open it, try again and its working,


**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
search should work,

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
not working,
**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]
so frequently,

### Versions
1.17.0 at windows,

data.title: Atom 1.17.0 with tree control hidden has bar cover covering search.
data.body:
I'm on Windows 10 Pro 64-bit running Atom 1.17.0 ia32. When I hit `Ctrl+F` to bring up search, everything looks normal. But when I it `Ctrl+\` to hide the left pane with the tree control, a thick bar appears on the bottom, covering part of the search fields.

The bar has a gray portion on the left and a black portion on the right, divided at exactly where the right side of the horizontal scrollbar would appear for the left tree pane, were it visible. (My file tree is wider than the pane, so when it is visible there is a horizontal scrollbar.)

Sorry, I don't have time to go through and do in-depth debugging, screen shots, logs, etc. But I thought I would at least inform you---that's better than not knowing. Good luck.

data.title: Bad Overlay Decoration performance on 1.19
data.body:
Since the rewrite of the TextEditor rendering (which is pretty awesome, btw), performance of Overlay Decorations deteriorated. Badly... :(

Specifically, [adding a `ResizeObserver` to **each** overlay](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13880/commits/893da22c5594eb2b740f7c0ec66608a7dcd8bf9a#diff-dd884e004af84f2b91dafb5510de7271R3205) doesn't scale well at all -- on my machine, each resize callback will take something from 1 to 3ms (this is just the overlay decoration from autocomplete-plus):
![timeline](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6735977/26364398/7fac66ec-3fe4-11e7-8392-200929db3fdf.png)

Let's add 100 more overlays and we get this beauty:
![timeline2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6735977/26363643/e9681b2e-3fe1-11e7-9754-37c6a01d00f2.png)

With Atom 1.18 (and 100 overlays), performance is much better (but not ideal):
![timeline3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6735977/26363835/9239b10e-3fe2-11e7-876c-ef460ea5f698.png)

The first thing I'd try here would be debouncing the `didResize` callback and not adding a `ResizeDetector` for each and every decoration, but I don't really understand why the `ResizeDetector` is needed anyways.
I'd be happy to look into this (and overlay performance in general), but would appreciate some guidance here. :)


### MWE on @lee-dohm's request:
To reproduce this, paste
```coffeescript
atom.commands.add 'atom-text-editor', 'generate-overlays', ->
  ed = atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor()
  ed.setText("aa\n".repeat(100))
  for i in [0..99]
    m = ed.markBufferRange([[i, 0], [i, 2]])
    div = document.createElement('div')
    div.style.backgroundColor = 'white'
    div.innerText = "fooo#{i}"
    decoration = {item: div, type: 'overlay'}
    ed.decorateMarker(m, decoration)
```
into your `init.coffee`, reload Atom, open a new text editor and execute `generate-overlays`. You should immediately feel the drop in performance.

### Additional info:
- The tests above were performed on commit 85e65ff, on Windows 10, and on a fairly beefy PC. 
- [`ink`](https://github.com/JunoLab/atom-ink/) (in conjunction with `julia-client`) was used to generate the inline overlays, but I suspect packages like Hydrogen will end up having the same issues.
- If anyone is interested in the timelines I'd be happy to upload them (since they can finally be exported :D), but I do think the screenshots are enough of an explanation as to what is going wrong here.

cc: @nathansobo, @as-cii

data.title: Tabs seems to be small; can’t reset size to default
data.body: ### Prerequisites * [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/ * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages ### Description The tabs in my Atom installation look different. They seem to be too short, and I can’t see the “top” of my tabs where it would sit in a gutter: I’ve tried re-loading Atom windows; re-opening the application; restart my MacBook; booting Atom in safe mode; but the problem still persists. I want to go back to the “tall” tabs like this: http://macosxbits.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/atom-for-mac-os-x.jpg Have I toggled an option somewhere? I’ve gone through the Core, Editor, and Dark UI theme settings, but can’t find anything to “reset” the size of my editor’s tabs. ### Steps to Reproduce As above. **Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen] http://macosxbits.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/atom-for-mac-os-x.jpg **Actual behavior:** [What actually happens] https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167312/26347759/751eeb60-3fa2-11e7-98ae-120a677a9ebb.png **Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?] 100% ### Versions Atom: 1.17.0 apm: 1.17.0 ### Additional Information As above.

data.title: :memo: Document Task.cancel
data.body:
### Description of the Change

Publicly document the `Task.cancel` function.

### Alternate Designs

N/A

### Why Should This Be In Core?

Documenting what is already in Core.

### Benefits

Package authors will be aware of its existence.

### Possible Drawbacks

Package authors will be aware of its existence?

### Applicable Issues

Fixes #14081
